page.title: 19An Old Lady Remembers
page.content: When interviewin Mrs. Wadley what she said most was how the place had changed. Years ago there were a lot of shops, now there is only one. Years ago Berrow Wood School was a mansion called Fisher's Place. The owner of the mansion(Mr. Fisher) had many houses and farms, which now have been sold to private owners. Mr. Fisher gave prizes to Pendock School children for their work about 47 years ago. Near my house is an old chapel built in 1824 and converted into a house six years ago, the tomb stones were moved to Pendock Parish Church. Where I live used to be a pub, called The New Inn. Mr. Pattison's house was the village stores. Mr. Moore's house used to be the blacksmith's, now called The Old Forge. Opposite my house used to be a shop, post office and wheelwright, now it is just a cottage.
